186029392.review:
Gran aventura de rol al mas puro estilo D&D o Baldur.
Cambia un poco respecto al Baldur en algunos tipo de personaje (imagino que porque han querido destacar y alejarse para evitar comparaciones, cosa imposible) pero por lo demás es un mas que digno predecesor de este.
La historia es complicada por toda la cosa de las almas y hubo un punto que es cierto que desconecte de la historia y tuve que volver a empezar porque no me estaba enterando de nada, imagino que tambien por el momento que me toco donde no tenia mucho tiempo y no podía prestar toda mi atención.
Los gráficos son muy bonitos pero creo que la historia es un poco lineal, no tienes mucha posibilidad de liarla como quieras y ver por donde te lleva el juego, aun con todo si te gustan los juegos de rol este te gustara

185982714.review: Gratamente sorprendida. He decidido jugarlo sin saber nada de la historia, sin mirar guías. Dejo que el juego me sorprenda, aunque esta no sea la manera fácil de jugar y requiera más tiempo; sin embargo vale la pena. Tiene cierto parecido con dragon age, al menos en aspectos de la jugabilidad, y un alto componente de rol, como en el juego de mesa de d&d. Es necesario leer (y bastante) para sacarle el máximo provecho al juego. Totalmente recomendado, especialmente para amantes de juegos como Baldur´s Gate, Divinity Original Sin y Dragon Age

185982658.review:
Наконец, после долгого перерыва, до прошёл эту игру, она определённо имеет свой шарм, и в нее по-началу очень интересно играть, но, всё не так радужно как могла показаться.

Плюсы: 
1. В целом, такой жанр игр это плюс, они самобытны, и прикольные, в них можно погрузиться в сказочную историю, и с кайфом по-изучать вселенную игры (Я этого не делал, просто как позер напишу что прикольно это делать)

2. Персонажи, не все конечно, но приятные, их приятно читать и слушать, так что, это плюс, но мне зашли, но всё равно много повторной душнины, и размусоливание истории, которую персонаж рассказал уже 10 раз.

3. Прикольный сюжет, а точнее, посыл, забавный финальный выбор, и дилемма, но, сильно не захватывает, просто прикольная.

Минусы: 
1. Постановка сюжета, хyйевый бляtь рассказ, мне вообще не понравилось, просто каша из того, что я то, а он то, ааа, вон это. И допускать даже мысли о том, что я не понял не буду, сyка, это компьютерная игра, тут макаке всё будет понятно. Просто в игре ужасная постановка и падача сюжета, он терпимая, но что-бы заинтересовать, ну 0%. Просто высер а не сюжет и задача у гг ясна, но бляtь, его основная мотивация мусор, о которой игрок не знает и не узнает до конца игры.

2. Не пошаговый бой, ахyенный скажете вы минус, а я скажу - да. Понятно что я от игры его не требую, но КАКОЙ ЖЕ мусорный этот бой в реальном времени, мне он не понравился, я тупой, или как угодно, но я использовал ограниченное количество скиллов, и проходил на высокой сложности, и было терпимо, но координировать каждого из 6 eбланов, это просто нечто, не зрелищно, не удобно, не нравиться, говно, хотя очевидно, что эта игра не плохая в жанре боёв в реальном времени, но мне такое не по-душе.

3. Нельзя комбинировать шмотки с одинаковыми статами. Кто-то скажет, баланс, а я скажу, долбaeбизм, вообще не прикольно, хочу убер-умного или убер-сильного или убер-блэк, та пошёл ты, просто комбинируй разные шмотки с разными, нужными конечно, но РАЗНЫМИ характеристиками, как по мне, минус. Хотя легко к этому привыкнуть, но надо отвыкать, потому-что, такого негде нет.

4. Ещё раз напишу, что сюжет мне не понравился, настолько, что аж 2 минуса.

Итог
В игру почти с удовольствием провёл 65 часов, но под конец, дропнул на неопределённый срок, задушила, но я знал что закончил почти на финале, так что, решил добить, и хорошо, жаль правда в DLC МЕГА впадлу играть, но хотя-бы игру до прошёл, и увидел финал, который не прочь был увидеть, после стольких часов то.

Оценка
6.5/10

185956756.review: Pretty good game but needing some QOL and end game balancing. Solid 8/10 and worth playing in my eyes.

185950338.review: The game is way more enjoyable once you understand what is actually going on. There is a steep learning curve but once you grasp all of the complex systems and understand the story and the world, you can enjoy how immersive and detailed the world and lore is. I won't go into detail, but in summary, if you enjoy using your brain, this game is for you. If you prefer games with a lower bar for entry and less complex systems, you may find POE a hard pill to swallow. I cannot recommend this game to new players unless they are prepared to take their time with this one, possibly even replaying to get the most out of the experience.

185913672.review:
写作有些晦涩，可能是我用的汉化问题，常常一句话读完不知什么意思。因此牧师、译灵使等队友完成队友任务之后依旧没有对角色有深入的理解，比如我做完译灵使任务线依旧不太理解其中提到的灵魂之铃是个意向，还是物品，或者只是地名。在进一步看到剧情解析后才充分了解这些角色的塑造。人物性格系统虽然想法不错，但并没有带来很好的沉浸感。一是选项与性格特质对应方面有时不太准确，二是性格选项缺乏互斥或者杂糅，对于实际性格的模拟既缺乏真实性，又未带来过多的娱乐性。

游戏性方面，主要是在狭窄地形战斗时角色容易被队友卡住位置，体验不太好。战斗频次安排适中。任务设计差强人意，数量足够、也有多种完成方式和交织关联，但缺乏令人惊叹的设计。但这对一个有着悠久历史的游戏类型是有些严苛了，惊艳的设计十分难得。本作的任务设计依旧是扎实的，节奏、细节、丰富度足以支持沉浸式的游玩数十个小时。

音画表现上永恒之柱系列堪称当前预渲染背景等距视角的最高水平，画面精致，音乐悠扬典雅，配音很好。

185913293.review: I drunkenly bought this game and now wonder why. I've played for 2 hours and have no idea what I am doing. My characters are weak and pathetic. I get eaten by wolves constantly. I have no idea what the story is. Nothing makes sense in this game. I have no decided if I like this game or not.

185907137.review: this could replace baldur's gate 2(played it and bg 1 when they originally came out) as my favorite rpg. insanely intricate in the way a proper rpg should be.

185868666.review:
TLDR: A great start, and a great homage to some of the greats. But unpolished, unfinished, and unsatisfying. 

[b][u]General Thoughts/Overview:[/u][/b]

Pillars of Eternity (PioE) could really be for you. It’s a decent top down party based CRPG and if you’re forgiving of its many glaring flaws, embracing what they tried to make instead of what they did, then I think you could really get along with this. 

We are a settler with a bad case of diarrhoea, which gets everyone on the caravan killed and as a plot point is never resolved… So I guess our companions are just really polite about it? Anyway the runs is just the start of our problems after we trespass on angry native land and end up being blasted by the big bad guy’s ancient machine. Thus begins the Fantasy tropes 1 (hero’s journey), 6 (stop the evil), 9 (Cure), and 10 (Stumbled into something). Can you uncover the sinister plot threatening the land, stop the big bad guy, and cure your squirts in this epic adventure? I’ve already spoiled one of those so the rest are up to you. 

PioE is a top down isometric CRPG, in which you can control characters in real time combat which you can pause to give instructions throughout. Your stats do matter from a roleplaying point as there are many dialogue options which take into account background race and ability scores. As far as projects go, this is massive and bold. 

So let’s take a look at the best and the worst of it. 


[b][u]Pros:[/u][/b]
[list][*] The art, atmosphere, and feel of PioE is just fantastic. Everything fits together nicely, and other than liberal use of the same limited sounds, it’s very well designed.  
[*] The game truly is a grand homage to the original Baldur’s Gate games, if you’ve played them then you’ll see their influence everywhere, and while this is a double edged sword in a lot of regards, it’s just [i]nice[/i].
[*] The one place that PioE has truly surpassed its predecessors, is in the loot goblin QoL features. Manageable group inventories, with an infinite carry space stash accessible from anywhere? No longer need a poor party with only 100,000 gold fret over the rusty dagger or the 17 flowers… Truly glorious. 
[*] Story wise it feels like thought has been put into ‘good and evil’. There is a wide range of titles and options, and good people can do bad things for ambiguous reasons, should you so choose.
[/list]

[b][u]Cons:[/u][/b]
[list][*] Kickstarter stuff. Kickstarter stuff [i]everywhere[/i]. It gets in the way. Is that a useful NPC, or just more fluff? Is that a name you’ll need to know? Is that grave with Pu$$y$layer69420L0L on it important? I understand they need to pay homage to the kickstarter backers, they literally funded the game… but I feel like there are better ways of doing it.  
[*] Disappointing boss fights. Basically none of the boss fights feel good. The adra dragon is just brutal and the final fight isn’t even a tenth as complex or technical… Which feels very wrong. 
[*] Expansion stuff tied to the main campaign – this one is a specific bugbear of mine, it only happened the once. But it took me hours trying to get two different groups to work together for a battle, only to find that they couldn’t and I needed allies from the expansions I didn’t buy. Very frustrating.
[*] Party AI is just terrible. I could write an essay on this, but I’ll just sum it up as “Unforgivably inefficient.”
[*] PioE feels like its full of cut content and half-finished quests. From adventures which CLEARLY had alternative endings and twists and turns just not finished, to areas which haven’t been used, and a map big enough for dozens more places… The game feels half done. 
[*] One thing which really turned me off PioE was how unintuitive stat stacking and spells were. Gear allocation is a fundamental part of the genre, and having enchantments not stack, particularly attributes, felt really bad. The spells not working out of combat, and skills and stats having funny names and descriptions didn’t help matters when it came to fighting. I know it doesn’t have the benefit of being the instantly recognisable Dungeons and Dragons spells and formats, but I feel like it could have done a better job of making things clear.
[/list]

[b][u]Suggested improvements:[/u][/b]
[list][*] Finish the quests, flesh out the empty spaces, and give some changes and follow up quests to the city after Act 3. 
[*] The combat system is extremely unsatisfying. It needs to be rebalanced, reworked, and re-examined. Primarily the damage system, resistances, immunities, AoE, spells and beams, and the AI driving ability use.
[*] Change the way backers are noted. Possibly name beasts and bad guys, so you can hover over them and see a backer name? I don’t know. But how it’s done isn’t very intuitive and actively breaks immersion. 
[/list]
[b][u]Overall Recommendation:[/u][/b]

I don’t think I can recommend PioE, and the main failing isn’t actually anything to do with the game itself, which might be a little confusing. The main failing is that it [i]isn’t[/i] Baldur’s Gate. Or, more accurately, can’t hold a candle to it. It had 20 years to improve on the formula, and just… didn’t. It didn’t even remake it hugely well. My main reason for not feeling I can recommend this game is that it took so much time to emulate Baldur’s gate, all it did was make me realise I could have been playing Baldur’s gate instead, and make me wish I had been… And frankly if I’d rather be playing the game it’s based on, it’s probably not a great recommendation.

That said, if you enjoyed Baldur’s gate 1 and/or 2. Well this is essentially a “Can I copy your homework? Sure, just change it up a bit so it isn’t obvious.” Meme. So if you liked that, you might get something from this. If you haven’t played Baldur’s Gate, then this could be for you if you like huge winding stories with loads of gameplay and a vast quantity of lore spread around in millions of words of reading.

I don’t recommend this if you didn’t like Baldur’s Gate… then you’re not going to like a poor knock off. If you don’t like lots of reading and only about 10% being voice acted, you’re not going to like this, and if you find that mixed real time with pause for orders style frustrating, then this isn’t for you either. 

At the end of the day, it’s quite clear this was made with a specific audience in mind. If you’re not fussy with your CRPG’s, I think they is very much for you. Sadly for me, I’m a little more discerning, and as such I have to reiterate that I don’t really recommend this. 

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/44852412/]My curator page[/url] with reviews by genre. In case you want to find more games, or even reviews, like this one.

185752332.review: Strong Baldur's Gate homage. Me like, Me have fun. Game good. Buy, play, enjoy.

185701263.review: My first crpg game and I really enjoyed it! The story is set in an interesting fantastical world with an interesting plot that constantly prompts npcs to introspect the beliefs they've held all their lives. The part I probably enjoyed the most was learning about each npcs backstory and how they grow/change throughout the story. The combat has room for min max'ing but also to play it simply to survive the combats to progress the story like I did. Great value for the hours of gameplay I got out of it!

185657185.review:
Well worth the price for RPG enthusiasts. Very old-school, though, so beware. However, there is an "easy" mode now, so even the most brick-headed auto attackers like me can easily finish almost any combat encounter without too much of a sweat.

The characters are interesting, the story is interesting, but there is a lot of reading to do, despite a few lines being voiced. You have to understand, though, that translation and voice acting is SUPER expensive, so for anything not AAA or at least AA it's almost inconceivable to do. Do a bit of reading, it will do you good. ;)

Combat is real-time with pause. I don't personally love it. It's like the old Baldur's Gate titles, but there's obviously a market for it. The rule system isn't to my liking, either. Every character has tons of abilities and spells, but it all just gels together (for me, at least) into a thicket of samey stuff, while melee characters all blob together and get tangled up in enemy groups.
And I also don't particularly love the itemization. But that's an issue on my part, I know that.

Like I said, I choose the easiest combat difficulty there is for a reason. It's a testament to how good the game still is that I'm enjoying it despite all that, BUT that also means that if you're a hardcore player you CAN really get into every little detail of the game, build the perfect party, set up AI profiles, etc. And this, to me, marks a good game. Too many games only offer you once choice: either it's totally dumbed down or so complex that any "normal" person with a life can't get into it. And that's a shame, because an RPG should imho primarily be about the journey, the story, the characters, while combat is secondary, thus I applaud the various difficulty options.

However: If they could just FIX the damn crashes when loading the game for the first time each day ... I have no idea what this is, but it pretty much stops working every time I try to continue or load a game for the first time, then on second (or sometimes third) try it just works and each loading screen is done in a few seconds. On the topic of loading screens: be prepared to see them a lot. EVERY transition requires a loading screen. That is less of a problem in more linear parts of the game, like Act 1 and Act 3, but in Act 2 you're in a big city. That big city consists of FIVE individual districts, and each district has a multitude of buildings you routinely need to enter and exit, meaning the whole of Act 2 is a loading screen simulator...

185568003.review: Fantastic game and very immersive.  I love the music especially the main theme.  Really draws me in.  Have spent over 100 hours so far and am almost finished the game but not quite yet.  Brings me back to the good old days of Baldur's Gate, Icewind Dale, Lionheart and all the classic RPG's of that era.  Obviously with a modern interface and improved resolution graphics compared to those days and a deeper rule system.  The characters are great and the story really draws you in.  Definately recommended if you like a nice immersive world you can get lost in and play at your own pace and a nice change from playing COD which I was spending a bit of time on until they finished with the MW2 remake and started pushing MW3 which was pretty average and has now put me off the series for the time being.  They did me a favour though because else I would not have discovered this gem.  If you remember the old Black Isle RPG classics fondly then buy this game.  Once I finish it I will be jumping straight into PoE 2 : Deadfire!

The writing and storytelling is superb -- especially after you get through the general slog of Act I -- and I appreciate the variety of ways in which objectives can be accomplished. 185294177.review:
[h1]A Return to CRPG Glory? Revisiting Pillars of Eternity[/h1]

[i]Does Obsidian’s ambitious revival of the classic CRPG formula still hold up nearly a decade later? After 140 hours and a 100% completion, here’s the verdict.[/i]

[h3]Review -> https://youtu.be/uP3z51Qy8BY[/h3] 

[h3]Achievements -> https://steamcommunity.com/id/Gaming_Analytics/stats/291650/?tab=achievements[/h3] 

[b][h2]Setting and World: A Realm Brimming with Lore[/h2][/b]

The world of [u]Eora[/u] is a masterclass in intricate world-building. From the colonial echoes of the Dyrwood to the metaphysical focus on souls, this setting thrives on detail. [b]Every ruin, forest, and village feels alive[/b], steeped in history and meaning. Yet, this depth can be daunting. Terms like [i]Adra[/i] and [i]Engwithan[/i] are thrown at you with little hand-holding, creating a rich tapestry for lore lovers but a steep entry point for newcomers.

[h3]A Visual Storytelling Triumph[/h3] Locations like Raedric’s Hold and Gilded Vale don’t just look great—they tell stories. The [b]tree of hanging bodies[/b] in Gilded Vale is a stark, unforgettable visual that defines the tone of the game. However, the sheer seriousness of Eora may alienate players looking for lighter or more whimsical moments.

[h3]A Rewarding Yet Overwhelming World[/h3] The game demands patience and curiosity. Expansions like [i]The White March[/i] showcase the potential of streamlined storytelling within this world, but the main game sometimes feels like a lore dump that prioritizes [i]telling[/i] over [i]showing[/i].

[b][h2]The Main Plot: Souls, Choices, and Consequences[/h2][/b]

Pillars of Eternity delivers a bold narrative centered on the [u]Hollowborn Crisis[/u] and the metaphysics of souls. You play as a Watcher, witnessing a world torn between animancy (soul science) and theological tradition. The game’s exploration of [b]faith, power, and truth[/b] is intellectually engaging, but its dense exposition can dilute the emotional weight of its themes.

[h3]Thaos ix Arkannon: A Complex Antagonist[/h3] Thaos is a zealot, not a caricature. His convictions challenge your own moral compass, making the pursuit of him across the Dyrwood one of the game’s highlights. However, the narrative pacing falters, with side quests and exploration often overshadowing the urgency of the main plot.

[h3]A Thought-Provoking Finale[/h3] The endgame forces players to confront [b]philosophical dilemmas[/b] about the nature of divinity and truth. While the choices feel impactful, the reliance on text-based resolutions can leave these climactic moments feeling underwhelming.

[b][h2]Mechanics: Deep, Flexible, and Unforgiving[/h2][/b]

[h3]A Custom Rule Set[/h3] Pillars of Eternity’s mechanics are tailored for video games, moving beyond D&D roots. Its [b]attribute system[/b]—where stats like [i]Might[/i] and [i]Intellect[/i] apply universally—encourages creative builds. A high-[i]Resolve[/i] rogue or an [i]Intellect[/i]-focused fighter is not just viable but rewarding. Yet, this versatility comes at the cost of thematic consistency, like wizards needing [i]Might[/i] for damage.

[h3]Combat: Strategic Yet Chaotic[/h3] The real-time-with-pause combat offers tactical depth but can feel overwhelming. Managing buffs, debuffs, and positioning is rewarding for veterans but alienating for newcomers. The [b]resting system[/b], intended to add resource tension, falls flat due to its accessibility, making it feel more like a chore than a meaningful mechanic.

[h3]UI and Feedback[/h3] The combat log provides crucial clarity for mechanics enthusiasts but can overwhelm players unfamiliar with the intricacies of the system. Inconsistencies, like unclear stacking rules and nuanced interactions, further complicate mastery.

[b][h2]A Timeless Yet Flawed Classic[/h2][/b]

Pillars of Eternity is a [b]love letter to CRPG fans[/b], blending nostalgia with modern systems. Its rich lore and ambitious mechanics demand investment, rewarding those who persevere with a deeply satisfying experience. But for newcomers or those seeking more emotional immediacy, it can feel like an impenetrable fortress of exposition and complexity.

In 2025, this game still stands as a [u]testament to crowdfunding and creative passion[/u]. For fans of deep, thought-provoking RPGs, it’s a must-play. For others, it’s a challenge worth considering—but one that requires patience.

[i]Recommended for: Lore lovers, CRPG veterans, and those excited for Obsidian’s upcoming [b]Avowed[/b].[/i]

185145958.review:
I've had had PoE for ages in my library already, but never made the plunge to play it despite eyeing it several times over the years. But with the release of Veilguard and thus the stark reminder that Bioware does not write well, nor does rpgs anymore, I needed a palate cleanser, and gosh PoE was the perfect pick for this. Since I play games, particular rpgs for well-written stories of engaging characters, deep lore and player agency and meaningful choices, and PoE is all of that what VG was NOT, and thus washed the bad taste of it away, giving me whooping 100+ hours of entertainment and immersing in a rich, detailed world crafted with love and care by the devs. I love the companions, complex and even as disgusting as some are (durance i am looking at you) the mythology & lore created, the depth of it all, the moral in betweens (no right or wrongs), the gritty setting sometimes brightened by (only) Eder's quips (my beloved) and vast choices given to the player to develop your warde....errr watcher :D It watered my withering rpg crops after VG. ngl.  Of course, PoE is a very different game, crowdfunded by ppl back then instead backed by a large AAA studio and by now almost ten yrs old and a crpg to boot, but i am still so glad i picked it up when I needed the kind of game most that valued my time & agency spent within. 

I ran into some minor bugs (one side quest i could not complete and some other small oddities, but nothing major. If I have to list annoyances, my main one were the loading times despite having it installed on SSD and that battles often did not stop after killing the enemies, since there were more of them at the other side of the map, so you had to clean out all of them and then go back to pick up the loot strewn all over, since you are unable to interact with things as long you are in fighting mode. Which yeah, is hopefully one or two things Deadfire improved upon, lol. Sidequest quality varied between go there, kill that and sprawling five ways to solve it with narrative twists, main story is actually is well understandable if you just put in the effort of not skipping all the text, lol. It is of course a homage to the old infinity engine games such as BG1&2 etc and thus prepare to read while playing. A lot actually, since only a quarter or so is voice-acted, which did not bother me after a bit tbh. The game also does a good job in meeting you halfway in explaining/showing its worldbuilding/lore if you pay a little attention imo. I hadn't expected a single playthrough to take me over 100 hours but having done everything but the ending parts till now, I can confidently say that it was worth every minute. Looking forward to spend more time in Eora with Deadfire and later on then Awowed, maybe :D

185139733.review: я не знаю, может я не проникся, но это были самые скучные 24 часа в моей жизни. Хуже чем такая скука, не может быть ничего.

185018472.review:
The game has an issue at this current stage, It does not launch unless you tweak windows region settings. This primarily affects Turkish users as i understand. Basically you have to set your windows language settings to UK or something. This issue was not present before. If you are a buyer from Turkey consider this issue. 

I hope the dev's will fix this problem soon. 

That technical issue aside. Pillars of Eternity is an amazing old school RPG. It might feel a bit dated in graphics department but the isometric format of the game with the visual style makes this a non-issue in my opinion. The writing is solid, the music is beautiful and encounters are engaging. Companions however are a mixed bag, some are interesting to have around, but some are straight up boring. Luckily you also have the option to make your own mercenaries to make up your own story.

In any case if you are an RPG fan and havent played this game, you are missing out.

184997845.review:
Well, somehow forgot about adding a review for this but it's definitely worth trying out for every cRPG enthusiasts. Game features decent plot, tons of interesting quests, npcs, items, great combat system and beautifully painted maps (really, one of the best out there). 

Game itself is long, my first completionist run took me over 80 hours, for the second one decided to try solo stealth approach and... surprisingly for seemingly "combat oriented" game (during first run killed over 2800 characters) it was possible without too much hassle and I've killed only 11 enemies (could even get it bit lower but wanted extra exp, which in the end I didn't really need) and I wasn't just sprinting through main quests, done a handful of side/tasks as well (over 30).

TLDR: If you like cRPGs don't hesitate, especially when it's on sale, and if you liked old legends like Baldur's Gate or Icewind Dale feel encouraged even more.

184912174.review:
Mi spiace, ma non m'ha preso proprio.
Bell'ambientazione, è un RPG isometrico vecchio stile, ma avere per ogni missione, che sia la principale o una secondaria, tonnellate di dialoghi da leggere che nulla aggiungono, se non una quantità spropositata di informazioni prolisse riguardanti la lore, per cui una volta finito di leggere tutto non ricordi in cosa consista la missione, sentendosi completamente perso in mappe dalla dimensione limitata, m'ha fatto desistere dal continuarlo.
Il combattimento è ripetitivo ed accompagnato da una meccanica complessa, ma il cui tutorial è ridotto completamente all'osso... A difficoltà facile possiamo lasciar fare tutto ai pippottini dell'AI, mentre già a difficoltà normale incominciano i volatili per diabetici, richiedendo un micromanagement ultra preciso come se fossimo in un Men Of War.
Per gestire l'inventario ci vuole tanta pazienza, lo spazio è illimitato, ma dover mettere mano all'inventario ad ogni combattimento, assegnando nello slot attivo per ogni personaggio, fa perdere molto tempo. Così come liberarsi di tutta la fuffa invendibile lasciata dai nemici sconfitti. Smanacciare poi l'intero inventario per vendere gli oggetti ai mercanti porta via più tempo anche rispetto al setacciare ogni angolo della mappa in cerca di qualsiasi cosa.
Mi spiace, ma con tutti i suoi difetti, preferivo Tyranny.

184881095.review:
A wonderful game i had for awhile and just now started to get into it. The story and characters are just amazing the world building is awesome if you take the time to take in the lore.  At first it can be a little overwhelming to get a character right but don't fret you can always re-class at anytime. 

looking for a narrative role playing game with choices that matter well here is one of the best.

184868713.review: The best isometric RPG of all time.  I have had 6 play throughs with over 880 hours for this game. The writing, atmosphere, characters, music, lore and combat are all phenomenal.  It definitely has the best combat system I've ever experienced for an isometric RPG.  You can program the AI for any/all characters on your team so that you can focus on doing what you want to do.  I love taking full command of a paladin and not having to worry about the AI doing some harebrained thing with my other characters.  You can have standing orders for your healer to use any spell you want to heal any character on your team with less than x% health.  You can have your ranger prioritize enemy casters.  You can have your rogue target enemies which are rushing your mage or priest.  The possibilities are endless.  YOU can program the AI for your team.  That's all I need to say.

184846556.review:
Une BO à coupé le souffle, un univers à couper le souffle et cohérent, franchement c'est malheureux mais le jeu est tellement parfait que y en a presque rien à dire hormis merci. 

Les donjons sont tops, l'univers est top en plus d'être varié. Les personnages sont extrêmement attachants (Eder et Aloth pour qui j'ai vraiment eu un gros coup de coeur)

Ne pas revoir la côte des épées ainsi que Kuldahar m'a fait drôle au début mais ce monde arrive à s'en détacher et proposer totalement autre chose niveau histoire. Pour ceux comme moi qui ont en horreur les 3 divinity de par leur jouabilité (oui j'appelle BG3 Divinity 3) Pillars of Eternity est finalement le jeu que j'ai attendu après avoir fini à l'époque et refini en enhanced edition BG1 et 2. 

Il ne s'agit pas de la suite de ces jeux mais clavier et souris en main on retrouve l'impression de jouer à ces monuments indémodables et inégalés.

184821560.review:
Un classico moderno del genere CRPG, con tutti i suoi pregi e difetti, ma soprattutto pregi. L'ambientazione di Eora è vasta, piena di sfaccettature e segreti, e sicuramente tra le più originali degli ultimi 10 anni. Allo stesso modo si presenta la trama, che oltre a far vivere al giocatore un roleplay unico, offre domande di un certo calibro e su cui vale la pena riflettere, come giocatore e come personaggio all'interno del gioco. Cast di personaggi fantastico e interessantissimo, dal fraterno Edér all'acido Durance, dal rumoroso Kana Rua alla cinica Palegina. Sistema di combattimento sicuramente adatto ai fan della pausa tattica, ma potrebbe allontanare chi, come me, preferisce un sistema a turni. Lo stile grafico è senza infamia e senza lode, vittima delle costrizioni tecniche e di budget. Colonna sonora poco presente, ma quando c'è si fa sentire. Consigliato ai fan degli RPG, ma anche a chi riesce a soprassedere al gameplay.

A modern classic of the CRPG genre, with all its merits and flaws, but mostly merits. The setting of Eora is vast, multifaceted and full of secrets, by far amongst the best of the last 10 years. The plot achieves the same heights, offering the player a unique roleplay experience and interesting questions worth reflecting on, both as a player and as a character within the game. Speaking of characters, the cast is full of well-written, outstanding personalities, from brotherly Edér to caustic Durance, from bombastic Kana Rua to cynical Palegina. The combat system is tailored to those who enjoy RTwP, but may alienate those who are used to a turn-based system. The artstyle is functional but not outstanding, certainly due to budget and technical limitations. The soundtrack is not too flashy, but commands reverence in the right moments. Recommended to RPG fans, and also to those who are not taken aback by the gameplay.

184817708.review:
For me, Pillars of Eternity is the real successor of Baldurs Gate II: Shadows of Amn, which is my top-rated game of all time.

The atmosphere is great which is driven by the immersive, mature writing, "real life", relatable character stories where not everything is fancy and happy, combined with an awesome music theme. And of course, realistic looking, state of the art, pre-rendered background graphics. Just everything is on the same, high level. A lot of modern games fall apart as they value graphics over everything, and lack, for example, a coherent story. Pillars is not like this.

Pillars of Eternity focuses on its superb world building, narrative and combat system. These are its strengths. It's not a playable marvel movie filled with cinematics and companion interactions where you can play in between.

If you like the classical infinity engine RPGs with real time combat with pause and want to immerse yourself for hours into a different world, this is THE modern take of it.

A must play CRPG - Recommended for those who love it.

Some elements of it are very perplexing, like the "enchant" system where entire levels are locked behind a single unique item (while at the same time the game world contains plenty of items of that given level). Also of course, by the time you understand it, you might well be at the end of the game.

184699185.review: Fundamentally the best CRPG ever made… in my opinion. The setting, story and characters are some of the most exquisitely detailed, evocative, and thought provoking in fantasy. You figured it out eventually through Companions, NPCs, and Quests but the starting was not very welcoming; too many names for too many things.

184677380.review:
Це дійсно духовний спадкоємець Baldurs Gate. Ізометричні рольові ігри з опрацьованим світом, багатьма можливостями відігравати найбільш різноманітних персонажів, класичної школи мають гідного продовжувача традицій. Всім фанатам подібних ігор варто спробувати Pillars Of Eternity. Відразу варто підібрати рівень складності для себе. "Нормальний" рівень складності, "як його задумували" розробники, передбачає, що гравець прочитає інструкцію і розумітиме правила бойової системи, буде детально контролювати дії групи, правильно підбиратиме зброю, зачарування, ефекти, їжу (для ефектів) та відпочинок. В такому режимі більш деякі битви, навіть із противниками у випадковій місцині, можуть тривати 5-10 хвилин. Якщо ви до такого не готові, то краще вам обрати простіший рівень складності. Якщо ж подібне вас не лякає, то будьте готові грати на сповільненому режимі під час боїв або постійно використовувати тактичну павзу. Гру проходив на Linux, вона працювала цілком стабільно і ніяких проблем не виникло. Далі про деякі аспекти детальніше:

Позитивні моменти:

- Світ
Це цілком новий всесвіт, який містить деякі цікаві ідеї та який буде цікаво досліджувати. З одного боку відносно звичайні люди та ельфи, а з іншого такі раси, як аумауа та богоподібні будуть нагадувати гравцям, що це незвичний світ. Трансформація та контроль душ, що є центральним елементом сюжету і багато моментів з цим пов'язано також цікаві. Його унікальність та відносно невелика кількість матеріалів можна вважати негативним моментом, якщо ви хочете глибше зануритися у цей всесвіт, але в грі всесвіт цікавий.

- Квести
Багато квесті багатошарові. Деякі можуть здаватися, як черговий "принеси-подай", але часто, якщо спрацьовують перевірки на деякі властивості, можна дізнатися додаткові елементи. І типова задача перетвориться на щось значно цікавіше. Сторони, якщо такі є в квестах, часто досить сірі й не можна сказати що хтось однозначно добрий чи злий (хоча і такі, звісно є). Слідкувати за багатьма історіями цікаво, так само як досліджувати моральні аспекти багатьох моментів.

- Тактична складова бойової системи
Правильне розміщення членів групи, використання специфічних типів атак проти певних ворогів, переривання ворожих атак, контроль за ефектами - все це робить битви цікавими і дає відчуття "заробленої" перемоги, коли після декількох спроб або навіть з першого разу, якщо вдалося зрозуміти підхід, противника буде переможено.

- Варіативність
Діалоги дозволяють по-різному проходити задачі. В кінці це зведеться до двох-трьох варіантів розвитку подій, але вони є і в діалогах це розкривається. При тому дрібні моменти на кшталт біографії, відомості, попередніх вчинків чи вірувань, можуть неочікуваним чином впливати на те, як саме персонажі будуть до вас ставитися.

- Графіка
Завдяки тому, що гра ізометрична, автори мали змогу зробити дуже детальні зображення, які виглядають дуже приємно навіть зараз. Для тих, кому потрібно ще більше чіткості існують модифікації, які дають об'єкти у ще більшій роздільній здатності.

Нейтральні моменти:

- Музика та звук
Вона досить приємна, але не можна сказати, що це щось рівня Morrowind чи Skyrim, коли хочеться окремо слухати ці мелодії. Проте це на колір і смак. Принаймні слухати всі ці мелодії приємно і вони гарно пасують до світу. Діалоги та звукові ефекти виконані гарно.

- Персонажі
Вони пропрацьовані, в них є свої скелети в шафах та конфлікти, які вони намагаються вирішити, але мене вони не чіпляли. З компаньйонів тільки один (Durance) мені особливо сподобався, як персонаж. Інші були більш пласкими. Сюжетні персонажі часто цікаві, але не рівномірно розкриті. Про когось хотілося б дізнатися більше. Інколи навіть потенційно цікаві персонажі просто виконують певну роль на кшталт "поважний керівник організації" або "підступний ватажок банди, який спробує з твоєю допомогою вирішити свої проблеми".

Негативні моменти:

- Великий обсяг тексту
Діалоги з великою кількістю виборів - це добре. Це чудово. Проте інколи, один варіант відповіді перетворюється на сторінку художнього твору з текстом "Він підвівся і задумливо глянув на горизонт. Його великі очі відбивали світ немов дзеркало і в них можна було розгледіти далекий горизонт. Якийсь час він стояв так, а потім червоне сонце врешті заховалося і світ поринув у сутінки. Він відвернувся, одягнув легкий шкіряний шолом і тихим голосом промовив: *власне репліка*.". Можливо комусь такий стиль подобається, але після багатьох подібних описів читати ставало важче і доводилося змушувати себе читати щоб не упустити нічого важливого. Трохи менше таких детальних описів або система уточнень аби можна було отримати тільки важливі моменти, які опишуть що саме персонаж мав на увазі спростили б це.

- Тривалість битв на "Нормальному" рівні складності та вище.
Тактичні бої цікаві й у них хочеться поринути, але не тоді, коли в зоні декілька груп ворогів це просто випадкова сутичка в дорозі й на це йде 10 хвилин, бо доводиться завантажитися через те, що десь пройшов критичний удар в одного з персонажів, а потім не правильно поставив персонажів у групі й все пішло не так. Доводиться витрачати ще 10 хвилин аби перемогти ту групу ворогів. Мій перехід у White March (11-ий рівень групи в середньому), був дуже складним і доповнення я так і не почав. Битва із найманцями вимагала напруження не меншого ніж під час битви з ворогами під час проходження фінальних рівнів Каед Нуа. Там доводилося купу високорівневих заклять використовувати аби відбитися від 4-5 найманців. Можливо це проблема через те, що я так погано розібрався у бойовій системі. Проте всю гру я пройшов на цьому рівні складності й тільки фінальне завдання й битву з Таосом, я проходив на режимі "Story Mode". Після попереднього рівня складності це було якось навіть не пристройно просто.

Для всіх поціновувачів тактичних рольових ігор - це чудове доповнення до їх колекції. Так само і простим фанатам рольових ігор варто спробувати цю гру, але майте на увазі складність та кількість тексту.

184524317.review: 量还比较大，但是主线相对单一了一点。阅读量比一般的crpg还是要大很多的，但我并没有觉得特别有代入感。世界观里对灵魂和宗教的构建很充实，每个神也有性格的展现，轮回机器的概念特别有意思。跑图还可以，基本没有什么重复图（对da2指指点点），无终古径的青铜大头造型很震撼。角色建模相当简陋，但漂亮的头像图弥补了这一点。前两章支线基本全清，打到第三章双榆城明显感觉故事有些疲软了。

184441252.review: Классический Fallout в фэнтези сэтинге, лютая годнота.

184425506.review:
An absolutely stunning game, placed in one of the most fascinating fantasy worlds I've experienced, be it in books, games, manga, or film. 

The companions are amazingly fun and varied. There is no clear good-vs-evil crap, mostly it's just a lot of shades of grey, choosing which choice is the least shittiest of all, according to your Watcher's character. And your decisions do matter, they impact the world, the companions and ultimately the second game. You have the scope to RP however you want, the disposition system deepening the reactivity of the world to your Watcher's personality and choices. I'm a little older and completely love the graphics of the game, the backgrounds are absolutely gorgeous. The music can be a little jittery at times, but it's not much of an issue honestly. The voice acting is simply amazing, on par with Rogue Trader or BG3 (though, it is not fully voiced, you'll have initial lines voiced and then peppered in here and there throughout the game). I have rather poor eyesight, but making the font larger was not an issue and was able to read everything (dialogue, UI or anything else) without any problems. Finally, the game is not too long, either. I am a *very* slow player and was able to finish it in about 150 hours. In comparison, I have already over twice that in Rogue Trader and still am in the final chapter. People who read faster, aren't bothered about flipping each and every stone on the maps and resolving every single side quest, agonising over every choice they have to make, will probably spend much less on a single playthrough than I.

And if you're here deciding whether you need to play it before you tangle with POE II Deadfire - know I was there, too, and yeah play this first, you will not regret it. It's not just because of the raw knowledge about the world, the gods, companions and all of the stuff you can learn by reading a wiki page, no. It's because the second game is more like a second part of the first in a way - the characters, the plot, the world, *everything* directly builds upon your experiences from the first game (literally, as you will import your end-game save from the first one that influences the world state of the second, Dragon Age style). Sure, it's crafted in such a way you will still have fun without it, but would you really want to watch The Two Towers without having seen The Fellowship of the Ring first?

184398164.review: Not as good as Baldur's Gate in terms of choices and overall presentation. The story is a slow burn, but in the end it was totally worth it. Possibly the best writing in a CRPG imo. I'd totally read it if they turn this game into a book!

184199465.review:
I don't know what it was, but this was not up my alley at all. I think you have to really "get" this style of game and although I grew up at a similar time to the classics that this is emulating I never really got into them. 

I liked Baldur's Gate 3 but i've always preferred real time games to taking turns where possible so I thought I had a match made in heaven here. 
Everything you read says you should play this first before the second one but even after turning on cheats to speed run the plot, the combat was still such a slog to sit through. And the pages after pages of exposition didn't really do it any favours either. I'm just going to settle for a plot summary on Youtube.

By all accounts, the game is a classic and that's fair enough. I love Obsidian and this was clearly a labour of love, this game was more or less their last roll of the dice to avoid bankruptcy. 

I just simply wouldn't recommend it if you're not all in on the CRPG genre. I should have done more research because I essentially jumped in with the mindset of "Age of Empires was kind of fun, I bet I'll instantly love Crusader Kings."

184191174.review:
Building characters in this game is so fun and Obsidian's writing makes playing that character really fun too. I wish the game was shorter so I could build more characters! That's not a real criticism though. It really feels like the old Infinity Engine games, giving me nostalgia for an era I wasn't a part of.

If you're someone who is put off by no voice acting-this game is probably double not for you because it also requires a lot of mental investment to learn its systems. Pillars 2 is mechanically easier to understand, has much better UI, and is fully voice acted. Don't feel like you need to play this one. But! It's good to read. You should build a typographic mind!

La parte di roleplay la trovo soddisfacente, solo un po' difficili da digerire sono i lore dump in alcuni punti della storia.

Первая ласточка возрождения CRPG с интересным сюжетом и разнообразными харизматичными спутниками. В добавок ко всему идёт сеттинг с своими фишками, а не типичное фентези.

184102754.review: Absolutely awesome re-imagining of BG1/BG2. The custom rules are a mash of 4E D&D and a percentile base system. While very crunchy I find that the system has grown on me more than the 3.5E clone that is provided in Pathfinder based games by Owl Cat.

184077204.review:
I can see two types of people being interested in Pillars of Eternity, newcomers to CRPGs (which I class myself as) or old school CRPG experts who will likely be chucking at my inexperience behind their original copy of Baldurs Gate while wearing a helm they forged themselves in their back garden, which has also been landscaped to accurately represent the Baldurs Gate map.

For us newcomers, all bushy tailed and bright eyed, I can say yes this is for you. With some caveats. First, you need to be willing to read a ton of stuff (obviously) but not just in game dialogue. I mean tooltips, stat descriptions and combat logs to actually understand what you're doing. I'd also suggest doing some research before, maybe watch a beginner video or two. If you come into this game not willing to learn the systems then you will struggle, smashing your head into a wall made from sentences written by your high school maths teacher, like "Miss (13+4-100 = miss)".

But don't let this scare you off because it isn't complicated, if I can do it then you definitely can. Once you have a decent enough idea of how it works then you'll be fully engaged in the combat and trying to build the best characters you can.

With a little pre-work, you'll really have a great time. The characters are great (Eder wanting to pet things never grew old to me) and I grew increasingly invested in their stories as the game went on. The writing some of the most original I've seen in a game, dealing with really heavy and serious topics. The word of Pillars is dark and one I felt immersed in throughout. 

So yes, my fellow newbies emerging scared into the CRPG light, you should get this. To all you hardcore, CRPG enthusiasts, with the character build for Pathfinder Kingmaker tattooed across your forehead, this is for you too.

183787979.review:
ACTUAL REVIEW 
After the first 10 hours, it actually gets good. I was only skimming the text, and still was impressed by the quality of the main quest. Although the Stalwart Part 2 expansion has a contradicting message compared to the base game. I'd say the main quest is better than in the sequel because of THE, AND I MEAN THE GOAT, Thaos Ix Arkannon. He actually leaves an impression, makes the plot good, and has pacing. I played as a Rizzard (Wizard with high Resolve and Intelligence, philosopher, Ixamitli Plains) and actually won an argument with Ondra, just because of the philosopher and intelligence traits. The game gets better the more you WANT to get invested, and when you get invested, YOU ACTUALLY DO, and don't wish to stop playing. I'd say it’s an 8.5/10 because of the slow beginnings.

ADVICE 
Check the wiki because some information is not provided in the game. For example, why is the philosopher locked to Ixamitli? It's like saying Germany is the place of the philosophers, disregarding other philosopher nationalities. AND KNOW THIS, STAT BONUSES DO NOT STACK, ONLY STUFF LIKE REFLEX AND NOT THE MAIN STATS

183786884.review: Imaginative world, thoughtful approaches, and rich Lore. The matter of acceptance of the latter is tantalizing, but the variety of spells, classes, and creatures, fleshes out a vivid world for all fluent players to enjoy!

183756788.review:
Could just be me but I genuinely don't see the appeal of real time with pause combat. It's atrocious, pausing takes out all the action and the system makes the game's combat feel generally bland and tedious. Would have been a billion times better to just make it turn-based. 

If you're like me and you really like turn-based games and really enjoyed Baldur's Gate 3, this game isn't for you. The movement, the combat, the lack of narration.. It all feels a bit icky and makes me stop playing by the time I'm an hour into the game.

183728132.review:
Pillars of Eternity est venu à un moment ou les CRPG étaient devenus désuets. Il a redoré le blason du genre et permis de nombreuses autres sorties.
C'est un jeu complexe et stratégique, au scénario envoûtant.
La direction artistique du jeu est très belle et vous plonge dans l'univers.

183665006.review: Obsidian's god tier dialogue and questing make this one of the greatest gaming experiences. Worth the money 10/10.

183556758.review:
Pillars of Eternity est un bon jeu mais qui a le travers habituel des jeux de fantasy : l'écriture est pompeuse et on te balance des tonnes de noms, d'histoires et d'anecdotes comme si c'étaient des choses qu'on était déjà censé connaître. Résultat : on ignore les bouquins et on lit parfois les dialogues en diagonale.
Il y a aussi trop d'options, de personnalisation et de compétences : paradoxalement, ça donne presque envie de choisir au hasard pour éviter d'avoir à se coltiner une réflexion de 10 minutes sur comment tel truc va se combiner avec ce que mes persos ont déjà.
Bref un bon jeu trop complexe pour son propre bien.
